meanings.definition: A person, typically a young man, who is perceived as being working-class and poorly educated, and who dresses in casual, sporty clothing.
meanings.sent1: The scally walked down the street in his tracksuit.
meanings.sent2: I saw a group of scallies hanging out at the park.
meanings.sent3: The scally's cap flew off in the wind, making him chase after it.
meanings.sent4: She always thought of him as a scally, with his sneakers squeaking on the pavement.
meanings.sent5: The image of the scally in his hoodie and trainers was hard to forget.

meanings.definition: To behave in a mischievous or unruly manner.
meanings.sent1: Don't scally around the house, you'll break something!
meanings.sent2: The kids decided to scally in the playground after school.
meanings.sent3: He scallied his way through the party, causing laughter wherever he went.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter scallied through the room, infectious and joyful.
meanings.sent5: The mischievous glint in his eye hinted at his plans to scally later.
